com.isbx.androidtools.utils

Class ActivityLifecycleListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isbx.androidtools.utils.ActivityLifecycleListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyLocationComponent, PlacesComponent

    public abstract class ActivityLifecycleListener
extends Object
implements Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
    Extending this class allows you to hook in to the major lifecycle events of a specific Activity instance.

    Due to the way starting activities is implemented in Android, a common use case will entail attaching the listener in the activity's onCreate() method, or possibly even afterwards. For these situations, you should instantiate the listener using ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity) or ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity, Bundle). These constructors assume onCreate() has already been called, and will trigger the appropriate callbacks.

    The only time you should use ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity, Application) is in the rare case that you need to instantiate the listener before the activity's onCreate() method is called. This specific constructor assumes onCreate() has not been called and will wait until it is before triggering the relevant callback.

    See Also:
    Activity.onCreate(Bundle), Activity.onStart(), Activity.onResume(), Activity.onPause(), Activity.onStop(), Activity.onDestroy(), Activity.onSaveInstanceState(Bundle)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActivityLifecycleListener

        public ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity activity)
        Creates a new instance that will listen to the lifecycle events of the given Activity. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has already been invoked, and will instantly trigger this listener's onCreate(Bundle) with a null Bundle parameter.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events
        See Also:
        attachTo(Activity)

      • ActivityLifecycleListener

        public ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity activity,
                                 Bundle creationInstanceState)
        Creates a new instance that will listen to the lifecycle events of the given Activity. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has already been invoked, and will instantly trigger this listener's onCreate(Bundle) with creationInstanceState as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events
        creationInstanceState - The Bundle that was passed in to activity in its onCreate() method.
        See Also:
        attachTo(Activity, Bundle)

      • ActivityLifecycleListener

        public ActivityLifecycleListener(Activity activity,
                                 Application application)
        Creates a new instance that will listen to the lifecycle events of the given Activity. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has not already been invoked, and until it is this listener's onCreate(Bundle) will not be called.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events
        application - The Application instance for this activity, required to actually listen for lifecycle events
        See Also:
        attachTo(Activity, Application)

    • Method Detail

      • attachTo

        public void attachTo(Activity activity)
        Attach this listener to the given Activity to listen for its lifecycle events. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has already been invoked, and will instantly trigger this listener's onCreate(Bundle) with a null Bundle parameter. This listener will stop receiving lifecycle events for any activities it was previously attached to.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events

      • attachTo

        public void attachTo(Activity activity,
                     Bundle creationInstanceState)
        Attach this listener to the given Activity to listen for its lifecycle events. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has already been invoked, and will instantly trigger this listener's onCreate(Bundle) with creationInstanceState as a parameter. This listener will stop receiving lifecycle events for any activities it was previously attached to.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events
        creationInstanceState - The Bundle that was passed in to activity in its onCreate() method.

      • attachTo

        public void attachTo(Activity activity,
                     Application application)
        Attach this listener to the given Activity to listen for its lifecycle events. This assumes activity's onCreate() method has not already been invoked, and until it is this listener's onCreate(Bundle) will not be called. This listener will stop receiving lifecycle events for any activities it was previously attached to.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity to listen to for lifecycle events
        application - The Application instance for this activity, required to actually listen for lifecycle events

      • getActivity

        protected Activity getActivity()
        Returns the Activity this listener is currently listening to for lifecycle events.
        Returns:
        The Activity this listener is attached to
